predefined_profiles.name: Li Cai
predefined_profiles.goal: Survive the war and reclaim Alsace-Lorraine

scenario: June 18, 1914, a day that would shake the entire world, yet at that time, Li Cai was still unaware of anything. Archduke Ferdinand was assassinated in Sarajevo, and the Austrian government put pressure on Serbia over the incident. But Austria was not satisfied with that; they sought help from the Germans. Those greedy Germans, without a doubt, chose to give Austria their full support. France's ally in the East, Russia, could not stand idly by any longer. This time, they absolutely couldn't back down. They hoped that France would support them in curbing the unending expansionist desires of Germany and Austria.

dialog.content: On June 18, 1914, this day would shake the entire world, but at that time, Li Cai was completely unaware. Archduke Ferdinand was assassinated in Sarajevo, and Austria put pressure on Serbia over the incident. However, Austria was not satisfied with just that, so they sought help from the Germans. The Germans, who were insatiable, undoubtedly chose to give Austria their fullest support. France's ally in the East, Russia, could no longer stand by idly. This time, they absolutely could not back down, hoping France would support them in curtailing the endless expansion ambitions of Germany and Austria.

: Yes, Marshal, my allies can't wait any longer. The Germans once defeated us on this land, but this time will be different. This time it's for revenge, to reclaim our most important territories. Courage and belief are always the most powerful weapons, and every one of our soldiers possesses them. As long as we can attack the Germans selflessly and relentlessly, we will surely defeat them.

: Li Cai, you're quite aware. This war will be completely over within a few months, and Marshal Joffre will lead us to victory. The Austro-Hungarian Empire has declared war on Serbia, and this time there's no compromise. The war to end all wars has erupted, and this will be our most glorious day. We will win endless honor. Are you ready? We're going to launch an attack on the Germans.

content.content: : (saluting Lauren) Absolutely, sir. I'm ready to follow all your orders. We will definitely reclaim Alsace-Lorraine!
: Sir, you don't need to say anything more. I have only one goal in this battleâ€”no hesitation, just action!
: General, reclaiming lost ground is extremely difficult. Don't you think we should quickly organize everyone to surrender instead?
: General, isn't this too reckless? Maybe we should consider things more carefully and cautiously.

question: #question# How should Li Cai respond to the orders to demonstrate his ability to follow instructions and rules?

content.content: : General, I have a different idea. We should be more cautious in formulating our strategic policies to prevent the repetition of past defeats.
: Mr. Chairman, although I have great confidence in our army, I'm actually a pacifist. Is this war absolutely unavoidable?

: Your Excellency, if I may speak frankly, I believe we should prioritize negotiations with the Germans rather than launching an immediate offensive. But if you insist, I will comply with your decision.
: General, anything you say, I believe it's right. Rest assured, leave everything to me.

question: #question# How should Li Cai respond to orders to demonstrate his ability to think independently and not blindly follow commands?

dialog.content: Li Cai, I'm really glad to see your determination. With a commander like you, we're sure to reclaim our lost territories.
Thank you for your trust, General. I won't let you down.

The war has been going on for some time. Although we've seen some victories, our progress hasn't been as effective as we'd hoped. Many officers believe we should adjust our strategy and spread our forces. Should we consider doing that?

content.content: General, you are right. In fact, after analyzing all the current intelligence, I also found that the Belgian front seems somewhat vulnerable.
Lauren, in fact, I was forced to come here. I don't really want the responsibility of saving Alsace-Lorraine. Please understand.
General Lauren, although we are superior and subordinate, I believe my judgment is stronger than yours. You should trust me and surrender now.
General Lauren, even though you have rich experience in leading troops, if your commanders can't follow your orders, then what's the point of commanding?

question: #question# How should Li Cai answer Lauren's question to demonstrate his ability to gather and process battlefield information?

content.content: Thank you for your trust, General. I believe in our army's morale and capabilities. We shouldn't split our forces; we're not far from success.
General Lauren, I'm just a minor officer under you. I think I shouldn't influence your judgment with my own agenda.
General Lauren, at this point, we have no choice but to push forward bravely. What do you think?

question: #question# How should Li Cai respond to Lauren's inquiry to show that she has confidence in the current situation of the French army?

dialog.content: (After being prompted by Li Cai, notices the crisis in Belgium) Great, it's a good thing we realized it, but their attack is still continuing.

General, this is the latest war report. The French army returned to aid Belgium just in time, thwarting the Germans' plans to attack from Belgium. But when they attacked on all fronts, we couldn't hold them back.

If the German forces break through the current defenses, they will advance towards Paris, leaving us with no way out. But you know, Li Cai, the soldiers in the rear refuse to continue fighting; they've all mutinied. What do you think we should do?

content.content: General, after understanding the situation, I've decided to join the revolution. Please allow me to mobilize the entire nation for a revolution, and end this war immediately.
Actually, I've already arranged for a ship. If we leave France by boat now, we can still save our lives.
Damn, their numbers are overwhelming; we can only retreat for now.
What do these ordinary soldiers know? This war is about cleansing the shame of France. In matters of national importance, individuals are insignificant.

question: #question# How should Li Cai respond to the mutiny in the army to show his ability to lead a team and achieve peace for France?

content.content: Immediately suppress these traitors. This is clearly the nation's most critical moment, and we can win ultimately. Nothing must hinder this victory.
Regardless of who it is, I hope everyone can survive, achieve peace, and happily return home.
Let these traitors fend for themselves; one day they'll realize, without the protection of the country, they are nothing.
Perhaps we should adapt and join the rebels; they seem more capable of securing victory.

question: #question# How should Li Cai deal with the mutiny of the rear soldiers to show his persistent goal of regaining lost ground and restoring France?

dialog.content: Sigh, revolutions are being supported all over the country. Since you've made up your mind, I can't stop you.
(With Lauren's approval, Li Cai joined the revolutionary army) General, this journey was a lot easier than we imagined. The troops sent to suppress us have joined our cause.

But Li Cai, have you thought about it? Even though you liberated Paris and reestablished the Paris Commune, once the civil war ends, you might not be able to withstand the Germans' attack. Will you fight to the death in the name of the Commune against Germany, or will you sign a peace treaty?

content.content: Though I very much want to crush the German army, we've shed enough blood already. To preserve this nascent revolutionary force, we can make some concessions.
Signing a treaty now will affect the morale of the troops. We need a real victory.
As a revolutionary soldier, if we can't fully realize the revolution, what is the point of our existence?
It doesn't matter how many French die. This time, we can definitely hold the Paris Commune. We must wipe out Germany completely.

question: #question# How does Li Cai decide whether to sign a treaty with the German army, demonstrating his ability to suppress impulses and prioritize the nation's recovery?

content.content: As the new revolutionary force, we should completely destroy them, occupy Berlin, and dismantle Germany entirely. This is the best chance for the revolutionary army to gain fame across Europe.
I think we can never completely destroy Germany. It's really a fantasy. We should conserve our strength and charge again later.
This isn't a topic I should be involved in. I can't make a decision about this. We should give the decision-making power to all participants of the revolution.
The Germans, the British, and the Italians are all watching us like hawks. We must flee quickly, or even the last bit of strength of the revolutionary army will be lost.

question: #question# How does Li Cai articulate his reasons for insisting on continuing the attack, showing that he's made a well-considered decision?

dialog.content: If you have the idea to join us, then you must think carefully about how to negotiate and sign a treaty with the Germans, and how to discuss the specific terms of the agreement.
Alright, your advice is very helpful. I will consider it carefully. Thank you, General.

To safeguard this fledgling revolutionary force, Li Cai and others represented the revolutionary army and eventually signed a treaty with the Germans. After ending the Western Front conflict, the Germans launched a massive offensive against Tsarist Russia. The Tsarist government collapsed, the February Revolution broke out, and the newly established Kerensky government sought peace with the Germans. Thus, the Germans won this imperialist war, but all of this was only temporary. Li Cai firmly believed that one day they would liberate this ugly old world.
Okay, I didn't expect you all to be so bold. Li Cai, I admire you revolutionaries as true heroes.

Li Cai and others led the revolutionary army to launch an attack on the German forces. Although the revolutionary army made a valiant charge, in the end, due to being outnumbered and outgunned, they could not hold the Paris Commune, and France fell once again.

: I have already dispatched troops to suppress the traitors, but due to the further dispersal of our forces, the frontline military situation is increasingly urgent. Li Cai, the nation is in a critical moment.

: General, I completely understand your difficulties. We should prioritize eliminating this group of Red Bandits within the country. The suppression forces have been deployed, yet the situation hasn't improved. Damn it!
: Perhaps we need to negotiate peace with the Germans. We cannot fight in the face of both internal and external troubles. What do you think we should do with the revolutionary army, Li Cai?

content.content: : As a legitimate French military officer, I will uphold my duties and fight to the end against the German army and the rebels!
: Working with the revolutionary army now would impact the morale of our troops, but we need a real victory. Damn, it's such a tough decision.
: As a true soldier, I must understand the art of compromise to survive; as long as the country is retained, there's hope for the future.
: Although the revolutionary army betrayed France, they are still true Frenchmen. We must first stabilize the interior before we can unite to eliminate the German army.

question: #question# How did Li Cai decide to refuse cooperation with the revolutionary army, showcasing his resolve to fulfill his responsibilities as a traditional military leader?

content.content: : Although the revolutionary army betrayed the military, they are still a powerful armed force. To preserve this France, we can consider making some concessions to them.
: Cooperating with the revolutionary army now would indeed impact troop morale and shake the soldiers' spirit. We won't be able to justify this to the great French king.
: As a legitimate soldier, associating with the revolutionary army would damage my dignity.
: The revolutionary army isn't really French at all. It doesn't matter how many of them die; I absolutely will not cooperate.

question: #question# How does Li Cai decide whether to cooperate with the revolutionary army, displaying his ability to recognize their strengths and forgive them?

dialog.content: Alright, I didn't expect you to be so courageous, Li Cai. I respect you as a true hero. I will join you in fighting against the revolutionary army until the end.
General, thank you. Please believe me, we will definitely achieve final victory. May France be great once again!

Li Cai and other traditional French generals were driven out of France by the revolutionary army. Fortunately, the British were willing to accept them. This was truly the worst outcome. Staring at the slowly vanishing France, Li Cai vowed that one day they would return and drive these French traitors out.
: Sigh, you're not entirely wrong. Let me think, it's just that this is indeed a very bold decision.
: General, please consider this. If the revolutionary army joins us, our strength will receive a significant boost.

Li Cai and the others temporarily put aside their differences with the revolutionary army to fend off the German forces. However, after the external battle was over, the revolutionary army and the orthodox French forces had another falling out, leading to a civil war between the two sides.
Oh? Li Cai, what are your thoughts? Speak up boldly.

We have only considered ourselves, but we've neglected all the other countries. Won't Belgium, Luxembourg, and the Netherlands be forced to join the war? We've completely ignored Germany's perspective. If they really want to defeat two countries at once and avoid a two-front battle, they must conquer one first. And defeating Russia is clearly impossible. We can't just assume Germany will follow our plan in the battle. If those small northern countries surrender to Germany or get invaded by them, we could face utter disaster. We should prepare a reserve army, ready to mobilize as the situation demands. Although this would weaken our frontline offense, it would be a bit safer. Lauren, what do you think?

(very supportive) There's a lot of truth in that; we ought to be more cautious. Also, I have a better planâ€”if the Germans do attack Belgium, we can shift our main focus there. The terrain there is obviously more suitable for an offensive than Alsace-Lorraine. Even if our attack is thwarted, we could make Belgium the main battlefield, minimizing the war's impact on our homeland. Although our south is rather deserted, the British have already promised Italy post-war territorial gains, so Italy won't betray us. Plus, the Marshal has developed a new strategy, though that's just in the speculative phase. Perhaps a bold offensive remains our most reliable option.

content.content: General Lauren, I believe taking the risk is the greatest courage. The German offensive has just been thwarted, and their defenses are not yet established. An unexpected use of the new strategy could be our only chance.
Mr. Lauren, you're right about everything; you're the General, we follow your lead.
Mr. Lauren, this plan carries great risk. I don't think we can decide so hastily.
General Lauren, this plan is too risky. We should consider a more secure approach.

question: #question# How should Li Cai respond to Lauren's inquiry about adopting the new strategy to showcase his willingness to try new things and adapt to changes?

content.content: Mr. Lauren, we should maintain our usual plan and launch an attack on the Germans as scheduled. Only then can we display the bravery of the French.
Mr. Lauren, our troops' morale is low. I feel I shouldn't speak carelessly, or it might affect their spirits.
Mr. Lauren, this is not a topic I should participate in. I hope you can give a clear directive.
Lauren, the more Frenchmen who die, the better. Ideally, only we survive; then we'd be the best.

question: #question# How should Li Cai express his true thoughts and stick to the current plan?

dialog.content: : We have already employed a new strategy, concentrating at a single point and then widening the breach. We are confident we can keep pressing until the German defense utterly collapses.
: We've seized the only opportunity to defeat Germany. That's fantastic; maybe this war can finally end.
: Li Cai, but perhaps we should exert more effort to completely crush Germany. Of course, it's up to you. If we continue the attack, the casualties will double, so please choose wisely!

content.content: : Mr. Lauren, although I would very much like to completely eliminate the German forces, we have already shed enough blood. It's time to enjoy the victory.
: Mr. Lauren, I feel I shouldn't speak recklessly, or else I fear it may affect the army's morale. However, we need a true victory.
: Lauren, it doesn't matter how many more Frenchmen die, we must completely annihilate Germany.

question: #question# How does Li Cai make a decision on whether to completely annihilate the German forces, demonstrating his ability to restrain impulses and prioritize the well-being of soldiers?

content.content: : Mr. Lauren, this is not a topic I should be involved in. I hope you can give a clear directive.
: Mr. Lauren, we should completely eliminate them, fully occupy Berlin, and completely dismantle Germany. This is our best chance.
: Mr. Lauren, I feel we can never completely eliminate Germany, this is really wishful thinking.
: Mr. Lauren, this is not a topic I should be involved in. I hope you can give a clear directive.
: Lauren, the more Germans, British, and Italians that die, the better. Ideally, only the French should survive, then we'd be the greatest.

question: #question# How does Li Cai persuade Lauren to continue the attack?

content.content: : Mr. Lauren, we should show leniency to the Germans, turn hostility into amity and reform them.
: Mr. Lauren, you might think I'm too much of a saint, but I'm actually a pacifist. Let's build a better Earth together.
: Mr. Lauren, I don't understand why you would choose to negotiate at this moment. Are you a spy for the Germans?

dialog.content: Li Cai, you're right. It's time to seek peace and we should let the soldiers return home.
Yes, General. It's been long since we parted, and I also greatly miss my family back home.

The French army did not completely destroy Germany. While there is some regret, this is indeed a kind of victory, as Germany will pay a heavy price. Additionally, the British are watching closely, and withdrawing now will help maintain long-term peace after the war.
: Li Cai, you're right, since this battle is nearing its end, I've decided that you will lead our army in the final charge.
: (leading the army into Berlin) In the name of Marshal Joffre and General Lauren, soldiers, charge!
: (received the report of Berlin's fall) Wonderful, Berlin has fallen. Let's take a photo together and we'll see it when it's developed.

France has defeated Germany, achieving ultimate victory in this great war. This marks the end of the European conflict. France, along with Russia, has subdued Germany, and the surrounding smaller nations will be under our control, serving as a buffer against Russia. There may be future wars, but at this moment, France is the greatest victor of the European war.
: Li Cai, your idea is not without merit. Iâ€™ll discuss it further with Marshal Xiafei to see how best to proceed.
: Thank you very much, Marshal, for considering my suggestion.
: Li Cai, weâ€™ve made a decision. Weâ€™ll go with your proposal.

The French army launched an attack on the Germans as planned, but it was clear that the Germans halted the French advance. Thus, the war gradually turned into a stalemate, with heavy casualties on the French side. Li Cai also sacrificed his life in the war, but fortunately, France emerged victorious in the end.
